SEARCH
Package io.github.epadronu.dwalin.core

Class ElementComponent<P extends AbstractionLayer>

java.lang.Object
io.github.epadronu.dwalin.core.Component<P>
io.github.epadronu.dwalin.core.ElementComponent<P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of parent this component will be associated with
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement, AbstractionLayer, org.openqa.selenium.interactions.Locatable, org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext, org.openqa.selenium.TakesScreenshot, org.openqa.selenium.WebElement, org.openqa.selenium.WrapsDriver, org.openqa.selenium.WrapsElement
@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault public abstract non-sealed class ElementComponent<P extends AbstractionLayer> extends Component<P> implements com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement

Element-like version of a component that mimics the SelenideElement behavior.

See Also:
  • GuardedComponent
  • SelenideElement

  • Constructor Details

    • ElementComponent

      public ElementComponent(P parent, com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement rootElement)

      Creates a new component associated with the given parent and using the provided element as the root search context.

      Parameters:
      parent - the parent this component will be associated with
      rootElement - the element used as the root search in the context of this component

    • scrollIntoView

      @Nonnull @CanIgnoreReturnValue public com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement scrollIntoView(String scrollIntoViewOptions)
      Scrolls the browser view to the element with the specified scroll options.

      scrollIntoViewOptions:

      • behavior (optional) - Defines the transition animation:
        1. auto (default) - The browser will determine the scrolling behavior.
        2. instant - Scrolls the element into view instantly, without any smooth animation.
        3. smooth - Scrolls the element into view with a smooth animation.
      • block (optional) - Defines vertical alignment:
        1. start (default) - Aligns the element to the top of the scrolling area.
        2. center - Aligns the element to the center of the scrolling area.
        3. end - Aligns the element to the bottom of the scrolling area.
        4. nearest - Aligns the element to the nearest edge of the scrolling area.
      • inline (optional) - Defines horizontal alignment:
        1. start - Aligns the element to the left edge of the scrolling area.
        2. center - Aligns the element to the center of the scrolling area.
        3. end - Aligns the element to the right edge of the scrolling area.
        4. nearest (default) - Aligns the element to the nearest edge of the scrolling area.

      Usage:

      element.scrollIntoView("{block: \"end\"}");

      element.scrollIntoView("{behavior: \"instant\", block: \"end\", inline: \"nearest\"}");

      Specified by:
      scrollIntoView in interface com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement
      Parameters:
      scrollIntoViewOptions - the scroll options to use
      Returns:
      the current instance of SelenideElement

    • scrollTo

      @Nonnull @CanIgnoreReturnValue public com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement scrollTo()
      Scrolls the browser view to the element.
      Specified by:
      scrollTo in interface com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement
      Returns:
      the current instance of SelenideElement

    • getDomAttribute

      public String getDomAttribute(String name)
      Get the value of the given attribute of the element.

      This method, unlike getAttribute(String), returns the value of the attribute with the given name but not the property with the same name.

      The following are deemed to be "boolean" attributes, and will return either "true" or null:

      async, autofocus, autoplay, checked, compact, complete, controls, declare, defaultchecked, defaultselected, defer, disabled, draggable, ended, formnovalidate, hidden, indeterminate, iscontenteditable, ismap, itemscope, loop, multiple, muted, nohref, noresize, noshade, novalidate, nowrap, open, paused, pubdate, readonly, required, reversed, scoped, seamless, seeking, selected, truespeed, willvalidate

      Specified by:
      getDomAttribute in interface org.openqa.selenium.WebElement
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute
